page.title: 02Dalton Village - History
page.content: {Dalton,}the ton or town in the dale is situated on the lower slopes of{Gayles {Moor}overlooking the valley which was formed by the{Teesdale Glacier}during the last ice age. The field pattern near the village is of medieval origin.South of the village is an Iron Age Fort called{Castle Steads.}Further South is an upright block of stone called{Stone Man,}where was formerly a large cairn. The stones were carted away to make fences and the skeleton of a man found under them was reburied. A mile S.E. of Stone Man, another tumulus was opened in the 19th Cent. to reveal a{cist-vaen,}or{stone {chest}and within this was a{kale pot.} Near this village also known as{Dalton {Travers}was a field which was held under the curious{tenure}of that{"of {finding a grindstone for ever for the {people of the place".}
